sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Blister Packing Machine for packaging tablets and capsules in blister packs using thermoforming or cold forming techniques.
sections.scope: Applicable to blister packaging activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the machine is installed in a clean area with adequate lighting and ventilation.
Verify that all electrical connections and compressed air supply are properly connected.
Check that forming film, lidding foil, and printing materials are available.
Power ON the blister packing machine and initialize the control panel.
Load the forming film roll onto the unwinding station and thread through the machine path.
Load the lidding foil roll onto the sealing station according to machine specifications.
Set machine parameters including forming depth, sealing temperature, and sealing time.
Adjust the feeding mechanism according to the size and shape of tablets or capsules.
Set the machine speed based on production requirements.
Perform trial runs without product to check forming quality and alignment.
Adjust heating elements and forming dies to achieve proper pocket formation.
Load tablets or capsules into the hopper or feeding trays.
Start the automatic feeding and ensure products are properly oriented.
Monitor the forming, filling, sealing, and cutting operations continuously.
Check the first few blister strips for proper sealing, product placement, and print quality.
Verify that batch coding and expiry date printing are clear and correct.
Adjust parameters if defects like incomplete sealing or product damage are observed.
Collect the finished blister strips and perform in-process quality checks.
Periodically inspect for seal integrity, pocket formation, and print clarity.
After completion, switch OFF the machine and clean all product contact parts.
Remove any remaining film and foil materials and store properly.
Document all machine settings, batch details, and quality observations in the production record.
precautions: Ensure proper training before operating the blister packing machine.
Never place hands near moving parts or heated sealing areas during operation.
Maintain proper temperature control to avoid material degradation or incomplete sealing.
Check for proper alignment of film and foil to prevent wastage.
Ensure products are within specified size and shape tolerances.
Monitor seal integrity regularly to prevent product exposure.
Keep the work area clean to prevent contamination of packed products.
Wear appropriate PPE including safety shoes and protective clothing.
Dispose of rejected strips and waste material as per protocols.
